Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 05:23PM Mimirod wrote: I had my mammo and ultrsound on July 20, biopsy on July 27, spoke to surgeon on July 29 for diagnosis, MRI on Aug 6, PET/CT scan August 18, PEM scan on August 26 and am now being told my surgery, won't be until the third or fourth week of September.  Is that a normal wait time?  It is almost 2 months.  My PET scan was clear and my IDC tumor is 1.6 cm.  I am ER/PR+ & HER2 -.  I am going for genetic testing tomorrow and then will meet with reconstructive surgeon.  From what my doctor has told me my tumor is in the early stages, but even though no lymph nodes showed up on PET scan I thought they can't tell until after the biopy of sentinel node which they do at the time of mastectomy.  Should I be concerened that I am being made 2 months from diagnosis to surgery? Mimi

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2009 12:15PM Mimirod wrote: Thank you all for your advice and letting me know that waiting is OK.  I have since met with a plastic surgeon and a great oncologist at the Sylvester Cancer Center in Miami.  He thinks becasue of my age I will need chemo, but there is staill a chance, if the tumor is small, and the nodes are clear that I won't.  I am praying for that to be the case becasue I don't look forward to going through chemo during the flu season.  But whatever happens I am putting my faith in God, relying heavily on Him and my family and my new found friends on this site.  I am meeting with my surgeon this afternoon and I hope to have more answers to my questions.  Talk to you all soon. Mimi
